website_summaries.verdict: This thin slicer apple corer is a good model for a home with kids or bakers.
pros: Cover/base makes it easier to get your apple all the way sliced
The extra cover is a bonus design feature
cons: This model must be hand washed

website_summaries.verdict: Cuts apples into 16 thin slices, making them great for pies or snacks for young children.
pros: Slices fruit into 16 slices and simultaneously removes the core
Cover protects fingers from blades while in storage and in use
Makes slices slender enough for pies
Blades are flat across the bottom instead of angled up so it cuts all the way through
Best with small to medium apples
cons: Takes significant effort to cut through the apple – be sure you're gripping the handles

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a short time, broke. Flawed design
customer_reviews.text: We loved this item at first. The concept is great - 16 slices works great for our kids. However, this has a poor design on two fronts. 1) Cutting 16 slices requires a lot of pushing force. 2) The plastic frame is too week and we've had two of these break - photo below I suggest getting a metal framed version that cuts 10 slices instead.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Dettmer

customer_reviews.title: Bad cover design
customer_reviews.text: It's a good slicer and makes nice size pieces, and the plastic cover for the bottom is handy to get the slices out, but it was clearly designed by someone who never actually used it. Why is the cover permanently fastened on so it gets in the way when you try to cut? At least they didn't make that flaw impossible to correct: use a small screwdriver or needlenose pliers to get the hinge pin loose and remove it. The cover still snaps on, still pushes cut slices out, but no longer shoves everything else off the counter as you try to maneuver around the fruit you are cutting. Shouldn't have to do that though.
customer_reviews.author: debrrose

customer_reviews.title: 16 slice is too hard
customer_reviews.text: This apple slicer requires an incredible amount of force to get through apples. I'm astounded by the positive review numbers. Perhaps there's been a change in the device. I purchased 8/12/18. The blades have visible edges, so they're not very sharp, but the amount of material that must be forced through the apple is the likely problem. Further, there are spaces where the blades attach to the hub, that accumulate apple matter which is essentially uncleanable. I will try to return.
customer_reviews.author: tech hater

customer_reviews.title: BEST THING EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, why has this never been invented before? It's the best thing in the history of apples! It cuts the apples perfect size for kids (and even me) and the bottom base to push the blade all the way down is a game changer. I always hated cutting apples because the last push was annoying and made slices fly everywhere. This is easy and keeps them all mostly attached. Love love love it!
customer_reviews.author: jbug

customer_reviews.title: My Little Tip for Using This Slicer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this slicer; in fact, I just bought another one that I can use at work. I was having a hard time putting enough pressure to cut through the apple, so I came up with a little technique: I just cut a tiny bit off the top and bottom of the apple, so they're flat. The slicer is super easy to use like this and it works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: G. Perrier

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan.
customer_reviews.text: It does its job just fine, but every time you slice an apple you get little pieces of it stuck in the nooks and crannies, and it can be very difficult and annoying to clean each time. It's nearly impossible to get all the little shrapnel out, so you end up accumulating crusty apple bits. This kind of grossed me out. If you prefer larger apples (like Honeycrisps), sometimes they are too large to fit the slicer. We ended up throwing it out and went back to slicing with a knife - it takes longer (hardly) and it's much easier to clean a knife than this contraption.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Worse than my old dull slicer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this apple slicer to replace an older one (different brand) that was starting to get dull. However, my old dull one is easier to use than this one! I had to enlist my husband’s help to use it and even he admitted it was extremely hard to push through the apple.
customer_reviews.author: MLA

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp enough to cut through an apple
customer_reviews.text: This looks great, but it is a total waste of money! I ordered it because I like the idea of easily getting thin slices, but this will not cut through an apple! At first, I thought maybe the blades were on upside down, but neither side of the blades is sharp at all. Using all my strength, I can not push this thing through an apple. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B.W.

customer_reviews.title: Only works well on small, soft apples
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed by this product. The blades are not nearly sharp enough to slice through apples of reasonable size and density. Small Macintoshes, maybe, but not Granny Smiths, and certainly not large Honeycrisps. I had to pound like crazy on the handles to get the blades all the way down the apple. I will try to find a better slicer for this apple pie and crisp-making season. Don't buy this unless your apples are all small and soft varieties.
customer_reviews.author: Karen K.

customer_reviews.title: One star
customer_reviews.text: It is very hard to slice an apple with this cutter! I was excited to get a slicer that would make thinner slices, but it is so difficult to use that I dread using it! I wasn’t sure if it was just me at first, but everyone in my family has said the same thing! I wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie Wheelis

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I am not usually one for gadgets in the kitchen, excellent knives get the job done and save on clutter. However, I succumbed to a blooger’s post about an apple slicer and selected this one after perusing Amazon reviews. I could not be more pleased! I used medium sized apples for a Thanksgiving pie and this slicer made short and perfect work of coring and slicing nine apples in a jiffy. One could not use really large apples, but select smaller to average mid sized apples and grab this slicer...it does take a little strength but the result is perfect...I didn’t have to do any extra trimming at all. One of my best finds in a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Great for more slices, plastic is a poor choice for the frame
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these. I much prefer this to other models that yield fewer slices. The bottom piece ensures that the apple pushes all the way through. I do wish the handles allowed a little more clearance as my knuckles hit the counter when I press all the way down. Most disappointing is that both of mine broke apart along the plastic seam. They still work, but must be used with extra caution. I would love to see an all-metal version.
customer_reviews.author: PitKristy

customer_reviews.title: Nope!
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but very, very dull. Very difficult to cut apples. My 16 year old could not use it. I had to lay over it using my body weight to cut any apples. Tried different apple types with same result. Threw product away and went back to using knife.
customer_reviews.author: -Brandi Thorwarth-

customer_reviews.title: Can only use with soft fruits
customer_reviews.text: I had a 8 segment metal apple corer that I used to chop my granny smith apples for green smoothies, and it finally gave up the ghost after almost 40 years of faithful service. I previously only used this one for when I was cutting and coring smaller slices to eat, basically a couple of pears and maybe 2 honeycrisp apples. But as my other one had broken, I tried to gently put a granny smith apple thru this one and it immediately cracked. I may have used this about 8x prior in total, so not impressed. My take away from this experience was look for an all-metal one. No more plastic.
customer_reviews.author: MountainNurse,BSNTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It’s just ok...
customer_reviews.text: As of now, I give this 2 stars overall. Maybe I just had a faulty shaped apple, or maybe I shouldn’t have peeled it, but I was giving it to my toddler and didn’t want to peel each slice. I get the concept but it didn’t work like it should... for me anyway... But I have a fruit bowl full of apples and I’ll give it a few more tries and update this edit. *UPDATE: I tried again, skin on, and it worked just fine. First apple was oddly shaped. So it works well on perfect shaped apples and not ones that may lean and be uneven in shape. That’s the only downfall.
customer_reviews.author: Ebony Bush

customer_reviews.title: Great tool until it broke
customer_reviews.text: I really wish there were a metal frame version of this slicer. Ours lasted through about a year and a half of almost daily use. Then the outer ring of plastic snapped. I don't know if that's a long life for an item like this, but if it had a metal frame/ring, I expect we'd still be slicing strong. The slice size is great for kids, and I really appreciated the bottom piece that flips up to free the slices without having to wrestle with them. Now I'm debating whether to get another one of these or try a metal one, which unfortunately I can't find with a flippy bottom.
customer_reviews.author: mollyb

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why this apple slicer is so highly reviewed! I bought it based on reviews and it is terrible! Great concept, poor execution! I love the fact that it would’ve cut my apples into smaller wedges BUT the parts are attached. If you use a normal sized apple, it won’t cut in the right angle making it nearly impossible to cut through. This product must be made for teeny tiny apples & did not work.
customer_reviews.author: MamaKorompis

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size of the thinner slices. This cuts more pieces than standard slicers and It takes a little more muscle, but it's worth it. It's high-quality too and the little lid that pushes the slices through you have to be careful with it, because they'll pop out quick, but the lid makes it nice so you can get the apple slices out easier.
customer_reviews.author: Sherril ✌️💕🌞

customer_reviews.title: I love this item BUT
customer_reviews.text: i LOVE this apple slicer but I need one for larger apples. Most of the apples I seem to see at the store come right to the rim of the slicer and makes it impossible to slice. I would for sure buy another since the one have now, which I love, only works for smaller sized applies. I love it because it saves me time in the morning when I'm putting my lunch together. It works very well (after I figured out how to use it! Thank you so much, Ann
customer_reviews.author: Ann F. Lindwall

customer_reviews.title: Handles cracked
customer_reviews.text: Love Apple slicers in general. I love this one because it slices into 12 which is great for small children. I also really like the pad underneath. The only issue I’ve had is the same problem I’ve had with others is the plastic handles have cracked after a couple of months. I have 4 kids and use the Apple slicer a least a couple times a day.
customer_reviews.author: CindyH529

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time or money. This slicer required so much pressure and effort to actually get it to cut through the apple that I decided I was much better off doing it by hand!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: The wife picked this out and I teased her a ...
customer_reviews.text: The wife picked this out and I teased her a bit about the "useless" gray bottom portion of the apple slicer. Then, I sliced an apple. When using prior slicers, after the slicer finishes the pieces have a little bit of apple left holding them together and I would push the sliced pieces out of the sections with my finger (very cautiously). The first time I actually used this device, I looked at the little bit of apple left holding the slices together and then I looked closer at the "useless" gray bottom portion. I slapped the gray bottom shut against the slicer and my apple slices fell right out into the bowl. It is Genius!
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: This apple slicer/corer is awesome BUT, remove the bottom plastic piece by force......
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking how cool to have a smaller wedge apple corer, and I love that function of it now....but, I had to break off the bottom plastic "riser" piece as it is designed SO BAD! You cannot use this on the base piece as it is connected, it's not possible, THE FOLDING/HINGE BASE OF THIS CORER DOES NOT ALLOW YOU TO GET YOUR APPLE IN THE CORER. I literally busted the plastic hinge of the "riser" base off, and now I just use this as a "push down" apple slicer/corer-and as this functions well for that purpose. A poorly designed product, but, you can adapt it!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Rudins

customer_reviews.title: Fast, efficient, thin slices
customer_reviews.text: This apple slicer is a quantum improvement over any other I have used. I originally bought one for my daughter-in-law. After trying it at her house, I ordered one for myself. First, it makes thin slices, which are ideal for baking pies, and also handy if you're doing a party with caramel apple dip. The black gizmo at the bottom allows you to push the sliced apples out of the slicer very quickly, so that you're not dealing with ends that haven't sliced through and refuse to come out. It's simple to use and seems sturdy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Go Steelers

customer_reviews.title: So I was glad to find this one and relieved to find I ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes it works just as intended. Fabulous. I needed a apple slicer that made thin slices. And one that was sharp so I could push it down and also didn’t hurt my hands. I bought a different one last year that I couldn’t push down so I had given up and gone back to my 30 year old metal one that makes thick slices. So I was glad to find this one and relieved to find I could push it down without any more force than my old metal one needed. The flap deal to push out the slices is ingenious and works well.
customer_reviews.author: RoseV

customer_reviews.title: I'm in Love.  Perfect slices.  Easy use.
customer_reviews.text: I have the 8 slice version of this apple cutter. I like smaller slices, so I wanted to try this 16 slice cutter. I was nervous the slices would be sloppy or more of a ripped cut. I was so pleased to see the perfect slices that came from this cutter. They looked like they were cut with a knife. I also could never go without the pop-thru action of the bottom plate. I have scraped up my fingers and lost the bottom part of my apple trying to finish the cut. You won't have that with this cutter. It is my favorite apple cutter ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amy G.

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Didn't know slicing apples could be so fun! 16 Perfect Slices of Apple!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fun to use & so easy!!! Seriously, 16 slices POP out!! Love the new way to slice apples - very cool! Sturdy metal, no cheap plastic. Tip* I am 5'7"...I make sure I place the apple & slicer blow my elbow height so l can lean into the press when pushing the blades through the apple. I do this to make sure I get through the apple in one hard press, instead of many little attempts to press down, make sense? Love the 16 smaller slices that pop out when you press the metal plate up underneath the apple once you have cut the pieces. This makes POP them out onto your plate. Great Design!
customer_reviews.author: Tina in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: This is great. My old apple slicer was getting dull
customer_reviews.text: This is great. My old apple slicer was getting dull, I had to put all my weight on it to cut an apple! Plus the slices were too fat, I wanted something thinner. . This slicer cuts the perfect thickness for apples, so I snack on them throughout the day. The first time I used it I put my weight on it like I was used to doing and it just slid right through in a snap, so next time I need to remember not to use so much force. Very easy to use. It is definitely sharper that my old one. However, the thinner slices are why I absolutely love it
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Keep it handy - it's safer than a paring knife, and does a nice job
customer_reviews.text: Protects the cutting edges and produces a clean cut safely. Nice to have something that stays sharp because the blades are protected when you're not using it. We've had this item in our kitchen for several months now, and I have decided it is my favorite kitchen utensil. Trying to lose weight by avoiding snacking on carbohydrates, I find myself able to go for a sliced apple instead. Much fresher tasting, and the bit of effort involved in using this thing gives me a sense of accomplishment all by itself. Way to go to whoever did the engineering!
customer_reviews.author: LimaBN

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I use an apple cutter everyday. For years, I have used the standard OXO cutter and loved it. I thought I would try this brand to keep at the office because of the thin slices it produces. Pro: I do like the thin slices it makes. Cons: The diameter of the core cutter is too large and cuts away too much flesh of the apple. The blades that cut the apple are not really sharp enough. I have only used this a few times and it is already dull and does not cut well. Unfortunately, this is apple cutter is headed for the garbage. I will be buying another OXO for the office.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: We don't use it very often and... it BROKE
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for a bit We didn't use it very often and it was a little difficult to clean, but we just bought a box of apples and on the FIRST apple out of the box it broke! It didn't even make it halfway down. I really like it. The little disc that flips up makes completing the apples a breeze and the blades were sharp. I don't know what happened but you can see that the part that broke should be reinforced. It the weakest part of the device.
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie Coniglio

customer_reviews.title: I love my new apple slicer/corer.  I’m glad my older one broke!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Apple corer/slicer. I was sad when my old slicer broke but knew I had to get another right away because I eat fruit salads everyday. This one has an added feature that my old one did not have. After you core and slice the apple you can simply pull the gray extractor into play and it “magically” puts the apple back together and you can simply take the apple off the slicer. It washes easily and is much easier to clean than my old one. Also, it provides double the apple slices as the old one.
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: Best cutter ever!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS THING!!! I have purchased at least 3 or 4 other apple slicers in my life and this is hands down the best one I've used. I think the key is to have the bottom piece. On the other apple slicers, it cuts in 98% of the way but then you have to push the apple the rest of the way through. With this one, it cuts it clean....all the way through. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: IAK

customer_reviews.title: Nice size slices and the bottom piece helps cut through the apple.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the apple slices and the way it looks together to get they final cut. Unlike some other apple slicers that leave so much uncut I have to use a knife to get the apple out, this on cut through completely. The only issue I have is, it doesn't seem to be that sharp. It takes both hands and all my strength to cut it to the point that I can lock down the bottom piece. But all that said, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Klapper

customer_reviews.title: 16-slice apple corer - awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Bumper crop of apples on our personal apple trees this year. Daughter and I made 12 apple pies and 15 bags of sliced apples to put in the freezer for enjoyment this winter. Slicer worked perfectly. Peeled apples and, if necessary, took a slice off the bottom of the apple so it would sit straight on the cutting board. Slicer worked great! A few apples took a little extra "umph" to cut thru, but for the most part, one push and it cut beautifully. Yes, I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a year :(
customer_reviews.text: This slicer is a great idea for people with kids. It has always been hard to fully press down on the apple and after getting to the bottom and closing the gray base, it will not release all of the slices. It seems like the tolerances are too loose. After a year of use, the rad ring has broke. It's a nice concept but, if this was half the price, it would be worth the daily struggle with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This little apple slicer is FANTASTIC! I was a bit skeptical that it would actually push the slices all the way through (that's been my problem with traditional apple slicers - I always have to push the slices the rest of the way through with my fingers and then also push the core back out of the slicer). This little thing just neatly slices the apple into nice uniform pieces and then you flip closed the "lid" and it pushed every slice *and* the core right out onto the plate. LOVE IT and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Raybugger

customer_reviews.title: Nice slicer, but
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this slicer a little over a year ago and have been using almost every day on Gala and Granny Smith apples. Sadly, today the plastic rim holding everything together snapped and attempts to use in this condition were mostly unsuccessful. Would be an excellent slicer if outer plastic rim was stronger. Hence I have no choice other than to give only two start for the single year of use. Wish it was of better quality because I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Frog

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to push for me
customer_reviews.text: My husband threw it out. The first apple was OK. Hard, but not impossible to push. The second, neither of us could get down more than an inch. Nor could we with the third. We had Gala apples which might be harder than normal. And they were smallish, around 3" diameter. No idea why. It looks like many others had no problem. Too bad because I liked the small slices. We ordered another that makes fewer and larger slices.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sized apple slices
customer_reviews.text: I have several apple slicers. This is my newest purchase. It seems durable. It’s dishwasher safe. It’s a little tricky to use. The gray apple plate thing that is attached is a bit confusing to use. I like that it cuts the apple in several slices. It is perfect to cut apples for baking. My teenaged kids use it more than I do. They like cutting their apples with this slicer for their after school snack.
customer_reviews.author: Warden

customer_reviews.title: Great for Making Cored THIN Apple Slices
customer_reviews.text: I have used apple slicer/corers for years but most are great for snacking apples but the slices are too thick for freeze-drying or making pie filling. This model makes thinner slices that are perfect for pie-filling and for freeze-drying. They are also a better thickness for my toddler grandchildren. AND- this is the first one I have found with the hinged plastic plate to dish the apple slices neatly out of the blades. Fast, ingenious, simple to use solution for processing buckets of apples from our tree. LOVE it!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Best suited for small apples
customer_reviews.text: It will work with big apples but it's not the process shown in the directions. You have to flip it over and push your apple through. I can never get mine all the way through, and end up with something that looks like a Blooming Onion from Outback Steakhouse. It's okay, I just grab the slices and pull the out the last 1/4 inch. Have to deal with the core anyway. I like the thin slices.
customer_reviews.author: G. Fujioka

customer_reviews.title: Makes thin slices
customer_reviews.text: I like that this slicer makes thinner slices than most apple slices. Great for pies or desserts. The cons are that you have to slice the apple without using the base piece and then use the base to finiish separating the sections from the core. I think the blades could be sharper and easier to start slicing. It works but is a little awkward and more work than it should be.
customer_reviews.author: bobbiesgirl

customer_reviews.title: About time someone redesigned the Apple slicer/corer!
customer_reviews.text: What a great design update on the Apple corer/slicer. The standard stainless steel ones bend too easily, don’t slice all the way through to the bottom, and hurt your hands. I was resigned to prepping apples with a knife but it always bothered me how wasteful it was. I discovered this corer on a blog site for an Apple pie recipe and it was inexpensive enough to order it...glad I did. its easy and comfortable to use, doesn’t warp or bend,and slices all the way through.my 27 year old thought the 16 slices instead of the usual 8 was “cool’’.....if I had one when he was younger he probably would have eaten a lot more apples for snacks......
customer_reviews.author: D.A.Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Does a really nice job and has made me eat healthier
customer_reviews.text: I like the cut wedges and cleaning was great. But, it’s the first apple corer I ever bought. And, I found it hard to push on. From what I have been told, they all are. However it does a great job Update: I bought another as a friend was so impressed with it compared to others she had used, I bought one for her. Also, I am actually eating more apples since getting this
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get this thing to cut an apple at all. There's not even enough space between the two parts to place the apple.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: Perfect apple slicer.
customer_reviews.text: I love this slicer and wish I would have bought one sooner. I had the 8 slicer for years but this one works much better. The size of the 16 slices are more conducive for eating and baking etc. without having to slice each slice again to make smaller as I had to do with the 8 slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: Unless you like banging your apple through the tines, this apple slicer isn’t for you. I tried slicing five different kinds of apples & I literally had to whack all five on the counter to get them to go through, that’s even with the bottom piece for assistance. I definitely do not recommend this atrocity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonwoman73

customer_reviews.title: Alot better than doing it by hand
customer_reviews.text: Just as it looks. I works good. I wish the bottom part(cutting edge) was sharpened to help cut easier but its not. It does take some muscle to use. Make sure core is directly centered in center. Washes easy. Put red handle part on top of apple. Push down hard. Then flip bottom shut n push again. I got this for snacking n works good but I should have got the fewer slice one. But this will slice it small for baking good.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Nice thin slices
customer_reviews.text: Love how this slices the apple into so many slices. Great for young kids. The shape of the plastic frame makes it almost impossible to push all the way to the bottom of the Apple, though, so the slices have to often be separated by hand because they are still connected at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: K Grant

customer_reviews.title: Works well nice small slices
customer_reviews.text: It is nice that it cuts the apples into smaller slices for the kids. Also the little piece at the bottom lets you cut all the way through. Im am concerned about longevity it doesnt feel the sturdiest but other apple corers in the past broke too, but they were at half the cost. The inlaws have one and havent had any issues
customer_reviews.author: david halverson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Slices! Requires a Lot of Strength
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted a slicer for a long time. Something to save me time on slicing apples for kids. However, this device requires a lot of pressure. If I stand on a stool and lean down with my weight, I can cut through and it makes excellent slices! It's just not something my kids are able to do. Do like the bottom lid thing that helps to push the slices the rest of the way through the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Darci Bullock

customer_reviews.title: What A Great Invention!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this after reading some reviews about how easily it breaks. I bought it, anyway, and I love it. It does not throw the slices everywhere, and it does cut all the way through. The wedges are small, but so what? You're still getting the entire apple. I've used it every day since I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Gattina

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: My last Apple slicer broke when I was trying to cut an apple. I bought this one because I love the face the the slices are smaller and that you can use the grey part to pop the slices out. Less worry about accidentally cutting your self. Occasionally o have had to push really hard and that’s how my last one broke(a different product) and this one’s easily stands up to the force.
customer_reviews.author: KatHug

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 12 slice slicer
customer_reviews.text: This has become our favorite slicer. It makes 12 slices rather than the much bigger 8 slicer we had. We have used it in preparation of over 8 boxes of fruit and it still works like new, Hard to find product but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: David Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time this morning. I absolutely loved it. I went from my old 8 wedge slicer to this 16 wedge. Where has this been all my life!!?? Definitely helps me eat more fruit. I can slice the apple in the morning, wrap it intact with core and all in some foil and then I have the PERFECT afternoon snack at work. With 16 slices I eat it slower and feel much more satisfied. Everyone should own one of these super handy gadgets!
customer_reviews.author: Tarv

customer_reviews.title: genius
customer_reviews.text: This apple slicer is genius. I love the small cuts so that apples go further at parties and they're super easy to cut into chunks for oatmeal or whatnot. I probably didn't read the item description but the top looking thing is actually attached so you push the slicer down on the apple and then swing the top and it pushes the apple through so you don't have to do it yourself and risk hurting your fingers. Genius. super easy, well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Nice size slices, worked great
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to use and clean. I like the size of the apple slices. Seems pretty well built. Blades are not to sharp. Very easy to slice multiple apples.
customer_reviews.author: C J M

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well but the safety thing is annoying
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty happy with this apple slicer however I wish it didn't have the gray part on the bottom. I understand that it's for protection but it seems pretty unnecessary. It's kind of just in the way when trying to slice an apple. I'll probably just end up removing it eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Sukup

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job of slicing apples and the slices really look great on a decorative tart. I would warn that a significant amount of pressure is required to push the slicer which could be an issue for some. Also, be aware that the core section is fairly small and slices from larger apples will require trimming to remove part of the core remaining after slicing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Makes small, slices
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I use it all the time. Makes small, easy to handle slices. My toddlers love the smaller slices. It cuts into 16 slices and works with large or small apples and pears. Rinses clean and has really held up to almost daily use. My kids like the smaller slices, so ask for apples more than they used to. I love it because I don't have to cut the slices into smaller pieces anymore. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jen C

customer_reviews.title: best apple slicer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep at work and everyone in my office uses this! It makes the perfect size slices and is very easy to use. It isn't terrible to clean either. Sometimes pieces of the apple skin gets stuck but that is the most difficult part of cleanup. I will be buying another one to keep at home as well.
customer_reviews.author: Clongworth

customer_reviews.title: Makes slicing apples abundantly easier
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, but you do need to put some muscle into it. It will not accommodate really big apples. I bought this once before and it lasted about a year before it started rusting. It is rather a pain to clean, but worth it because of how easy it makes cutting up an apple.
customer_reviews.author: tutu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect slices require a bit of muscle
customer_reviews.text: Love the results: perfectly even and thin slices every time. Since I have bought this I have doubled my apple consumption. Why only 4 stars? It takes some muscle! Especially on larger apples. Sometimes the slicer gets stuck. The thin slices require a significant amount of force. They also make cleanup a little harder too. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothee

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I disliked that the bottom is screwed onto the top. Maybe some people can use this, but I am 5'1 and cannot push down easily on an apple with it together. It's a funny angle with my height and strength. That's why I give it a 3 the way it is. If you spend the time taking it a part have the two separated it's usually fine. But its faster to grab a cutting board.
customer_reviews.author: ck3ler

customer_reviews.title: Successful usage depends on apple size
customer_reviews.text: No instructions came with product. Figured it out on my own. Product made for small to medium small apples only. Blades moderately sharp but cutting requires fair amount of strength. Probably won't purchase again but will core and then usemy food processor.
customer_reviews.author: Nameless

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: What a neat contraption! I purchased the 16 piece slicer which does need some extra umph behind the slicing, but the pieces are small and easy to eat. The bottom that pushes the slices out is amazing!!! Most of the time the pieces come out cleanly, but occasionally I have to pull a slice or two out. I've had it for about two months and use it about once or twice a week, and so far it's held up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Notubutme

customer_reviews.title: Perfect thinner slices
customer_reviews.text: I prefer thinner apple slices, so I used to use a standard apple slicer and then cut those slices in half. This makes the perfect thinner slices, plus it has the piece to push the slices and core out, which I used to have to manually. Put it folded open in the dishwasher and it gets totally clean.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Durable and works well
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the second one of these that I bought, it lasted at least 3 years of constant use before the red part cracked and it was still sharp. I rinse it after every use and wash it every few apples I use it for. Perfect size slices for kids. I’ll keep buying these because they work so well.
customer_reviews.author: AujOnFire

customer_reviews.title: Great design idea. Terrible execution.
customer_reviews.text: The design is outstanding and works like a charm. Unfortunately the blades almost seem like they've not been sharpened at all. Force required to actually slice the apple is ridiculous. Not worth returning. Round filed it. At least it didn't cost much.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Goller

customer_reviews.title: Great slicer...until it cracked.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this slicer. Seriously the perfect size slices for me and kiddos. Makes it feels like an apple goes further. And we use it to slice potatoes to make fries. But sadly, my husband showed me where it cracked down the side. *sad face* We've only had it for a year, and it's now no good. What a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I like how this slices the apple in uniform small wedges. It cores the apple well, too. It is best cleaned with a dish washing bristled brush so as not to get cut. It is sharp. Used correctly, according to directions, the pieces pop right out. I would definitely recommend this and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: The Best Apple Slicer Out There
customer_reviews.text: I'm convinced that this is the best apple slicer in existence. Normally when I'm cutting apples, I'm cutting them for my kids. Those other 8-slice apple slicers make pieces that are just too big. This one creates 16 perfectly-sized slices that are good for little mouths and adults alike. I didn't even realize the gray bottom could be used to push the apple all the way through and make cutting even easier until I had owned it for several months (I thought it was just a guard to protect the blades.) Amazing. I recommend this to any mom who I get into conversations about apples with (which happens more than one might expect!)
customer_reviews.author: TTS77

customer_reviews.title: Had it for 2 days before it broke
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I ordered this same one a couple years back and it just wore out so I reordered the same one and used it once or twice in 2 days and it broke! Guess the plastic was different. I will send this one back and buy a metal one.
customer_reviews.author: mrs. orchard

customer_reviews.title: A Great Upgrade On My 8 Slice Slicer!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an apple slicer to slice the apples thinner than my old 8 slice slicer. I bought this and have been very happy. The plastic part that fits on to protect you from the blades doubles as a way to push the core and slices up through. This has taken the work out of making apple pies by slicing the apples thin so they cook quickly. I used to have to slice them by hand even after using my old 8 slice slicer to make them thin enough. I love this and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Troutbum21

customer_reviews.title: I like the thin slices
customer_reviews.text: This makes my daily apple snack something special. Especially pleased with the 12 slices. My two other ones only make 8 slices. I prefer the slices thinner and almost never use the thicker slicers. The form-fitting bottom provides the finishing touch, to get the blades to slice completely through the apple. It is harder to press 12 blades than 8, but follow the directions and place on a firm tabletop, rather than the countertop. This allows you to get the leverage you need more easily. I also initially press somewhat slowly until the skin of the apple is pierced, then press harder (faster) to make the cut. Then fold the hinged bottom into place and finish.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Cuts smaller pieces- plus
customer_reviews.text: I got this to have the smaller slices...and I love it...the trick is to start pushing through the apple and then close the bottom ...and it cuts all the way through...I love it. Makes it great for little kids, more apple to go around
customer_reviews.author: Storm ( Trisha)

customer_reviews.title: Use it every day
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this. I love the size of the slices. My boyfriend eats an apple everyday at work and the other day looked at me and said, "this is the best thing we've ever bought, huh." haha. The slice size is perfect and its so quick and easy to quickly cut an apple and throw in a bag for work. LOVE LOVE LOVE this.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: You’ll never want to chop up an apple with a knife again
customer_reviews.text: It took me a few minutes to understand how to use it. You have to push the Apple onto it about a third of the way before closing the lid and pressing down on the bench with the handles. It sure sliced through that Apple in a hurry popping out the core like a cork from a bottle. Fantastic device. Used it twice today already after just receiving it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Sunny Las Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for apples and potatoes and other stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for quick work on small potatoes, and boy does it make cooking QUICK. You definitely can't just rail down on it with a lot of force, you must use a little finesse and find the angle that works for the size of what you're cutting. After that it's all just a push away. I enjoy the variation in weird sizes so that it adds some variety to what I'm cooking as well.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for small slices that cut all the way through, but breaks too quickly
customer_reviews.text: I love this slicer, but I've bought three of them and each has broken. I like that it cuts thin slices. I like the bottom so that you can push all the way through. But, I really wish it was metal so that it didn't break. Not sure I'll buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Law

customer_reviews.title: Helpful tool from your gadget drawer!
customer_reviews.text: Go for the 16 section slicer style. So helpful. Salads w/ apples and pears become a breeze! Apple snacks so easy! The snap feature pops the food out w/ ease. With my almost daily use, I have a couple for my use plus have extras on hand as a hostess gifts. Have purchased multiple time : )
customer_reviews.author: fogger

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use, but needs muscles
customer_reviews.text: Feels really atoms while pushing down on apple, but takes quite a bit of effort to cut through the apple. I love the design and function of it. The first time I used it the apples really did "pop" everywhere!! I'm getting more used to using it and makes for cutting apples an east thing to do!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cracked after a few uses, Broke after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I purposely used this very gently because it’s plastic and didn’t seem real strong. After a few uses it developed a crack, and today it broke all the way, 2 years almost to the day since I bought it. They need to make the circular part with a metal frame in it. I will not be purchasing this again.
customer_reviews.author: Tegan

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this!! I like the smaller slices and the bottom part that pushes the apple all the way through. No more cutting my fingers trying to push it through myself. It is well made so I’m sure it will last a while.

customer_reviews.title: Slicer to end all slicers
customer_reviews.text: This is THE perfect slicer. No more forcing the blades through skin at the end of cutting. This slicer has an ingenious piece that flips over at the end of slicing to insure the blades cut thru every last bit and form perfect individual pieces. I’ll never use another brand again.
customer_reviews.author: SMS1253

customer_reviews.title: Really lousy product.  Would not even cut butter!
customer_reviews.text: The most important thing for you to know is that it absolutely does NOT cut apples!!! It wouldn't even cut tomatoes!!! Try it with marshmallos. Also, they do not let you return it. You are stuck with an extremely lousy product.
customer_reviews.author: shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: The hinged pusher plate make this a 5 star slicer
customer_reviews.text: One thing I hated about the regular apple slicers is having to push the core and many of the slices out because the design prevented pushing all the way through. The hinged pusher plate on this slicer eliminates this problem and you can easily close the plate and push all slices and the core out. Great value even at twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Michaelis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sized slices
customer_reviews.text: This apple slicer is great. It makes perfect sized/width apple slices not only for my kids, but I found I also like the thinner slices as well. The grey part that pops the cut Apple pieces out of the slicer works as intended but is a bit hard for my 6 and 4 year olds to use, which isn't an issue for me. My husband thinks the grey piece should be removable and snap on for storage, so it would act more like a cutting board in addition to slice pusher. I don't mind slicing the apples on a plate, but can see his point. All in all, worth the price :)
customer_reviews.author: SD mom

customer_reviews.title: It's an apple slicer
customer_reviews.text: I don't like biting into apples. That's what the evil witch wants you to do, so I'm not going to do it. This Apple Slicer gives me bite-sized apple goodness, perfect for dunking or dipping or just munching. Plus it's safer since you can see, clearly, in each cleanly sliced, equally-sized apple sliver that there is no evil witch poison in the apple. Or worms. Or seeds! It's really a necessity.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Love the number of slices, but it dulled quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of this product, which makes tons of small slices which are perfect for baking. However, after using it for a bout 2 weeks, it is now too dull to cut through apples—even though I tried numerous ways to keep from dulling the blades, such as avoiding high heat and using the top rack of the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: KML

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I have loved apples and peanut butter since kindergarten. The one thing I hated is how thick my slices were with other slicers. When I found out that this company offered a 16 slicer I was so happy. I can slice my gala apples and evenly apply peanut butter. The ratio is never off. It is so easy to use and wash.
customer_reviews.author: Evans Family

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the extra part that this slicer has which helps slice the apple to the very bottom with easy removal. I only wish it fit the extra large honey crisps that GA had this past season. I dont think any apple corer slicer is big enough for those :)
customer_reviews.author: p j m pavlosky

customer_reviews.title: You’ll never know this item is a necessity until you get one!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old son decided that he needed an apple slicers. After looking at Walmart and Target, I decided on this one. I have to say I’m very happy with the purchase. My son was told to cut up his apples when he got braces and this is one of the best items I’ve purchased in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 16-cut apple slicer!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It seems very durable and it is easy to clean. It’s a little hard to use at times if you don’t have much upper body strength (due to chronic illness), but it makes cutting apples much easier and quicker. The bottom piece is nice when the apples are almost cut to make sure they all pop out without getting stuck. I also love the 16 slice option!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: I had never seen a 12-slice size product before and ordered it promptly. It is simply ingenious -- perfect sized apple slices for so many things. I especially like giving these size slices to small children and my pet Shih Tzu! -- they both can swallow them easily and, if I'm trying to eat the apple slices myself, there are now a few extra slices to "share" I'm ordering several more of these for my Grandchildren's parents for Christmas - might include a few apples!
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Best apple slicer I’ve found!
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time! Very durable and works very well. The gray push tray is a great addition and makes it much easier to get all the apple slices out than the older versions of these slicers. I like that it does thinner slices (16) and that the corer section is large enough to get all the seeds. It’s been a game changer!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Must buy apple slicer!
customer_reviews.text: My mother in law gave me one of these as a gift and I can't go back to a normal size apple cutter! These make a apple seem so much bigger because of the amount of slices. Not to mention my toddler has a easier time eating the apple with them sliced this thin. Love that it has the gaurd for fingers because it is super sharp. And I like that it has the gaurd to also push the rest of the ape through! Must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Great for big families and classrooms.
customer_reviews.text: All my kids like apples and would eat a whole one each daily! I think it is better to eat these thin slices and not end up with apple cores in pockets and such. They make putting bits of apple into salads and other dishes easy. Great for pies.
customer_reviews.author: Nakiah Burnes

customer_reviews.title: The best one we've had!
customer_reviews.text: Our kids eat apples like crazy so we have had a lot of apple cutters in our house. This is THE BEST one we've had. It is super easy, cuts the apple in smaller pieces, and the gray part pops it all out nice and easy. Easy to clean also.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Cantrell

product_meta.title: Prepworks by Progressive 16-Slice Thin Apple Slicer & Corer
product_meta.description:
The Thin Apple Slicer from Prepworks by Progressive is a quick and safe way to easily core and slice an apple. With the Thin Apple Slicer it's as easy as push, flip and pop. Place apple on countertop, stem side down. Simply push the prep works thin apple slicer blades down over the apple, flip the protective cover underneath and pop the apple slices the rest of the way through the blades.

For over 40 years, our mission has been to create innovative kitchen tools and gadgets that make food preparation fun and fast while inspiring culinary creativity. From our thinstore™ collapsibles to our sophisticated PL8™ line, our dedication to providing quality products supported by superior customer service continues to drive our creative development today.

At Progressive International, we continually strive to understand the needs of today’s cooks. Our team includes talented, energetic and passionate people committed to reimagining the kitchen. We strive to pass our passion on to our consumers through our thoughtfully designed tools, layered with our avid desire to go beyond the expected.

Our philosophy is simple: offer stylish designs complimented by no-nonsense functionality. We understand the kitchen is the heart of the home, where families and friends connect. Our ongoing mission is to provide exceptional kitchen essentials that help cooks of all skill levels create meals worth sharing.

Prep Solutions;, Prepworks and PL8 continues to build on the Progressive; legacy by offering products that make food prep faster, easier and more enjoyable.
feature_bullets: EASY TO USE APPLE SLICER & CORER: Quickly & easily slice & core apples into 16 even slices! This dishwasher safe Thin Apple Slicer & Corer will core & slice an entire apple with a simple push.
INNOVATIVE DESIGN: The attached safety cover, when used as a base, will push apple slices & the core clear of the blades. It's designed to protect fingers while in use & cover blades when stored.
FOOD PREP MADE EASY: We offer kitchen accessories that make food preparation faster, easier & more enjoyable, from fruit & veggie choppers to measuring spoons & cups & collapsible storage bowls.

STYLISH DESIGN & SOLID FUNCTIONALITY: Our philosophy is simple—offer stylish designs with no-nonsense functionality. We understand the kitchen is the heart of the home, where family & friends connect.
INNOVATING KITCHEN ESSENTIALS: We boast over 40 years of innovating kitchen products & housewares with unique gadgets & tools for food preparation plus thoughtfully designed food storage containers.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
